qas.question: What is the name of the university's core curriculum?
During 2012-2013, how many student were able to take the Core classes at a single time?
UChicago claims to have what kind of learning experience compared to other universities?
What guide states the Univeristy of Chicago is known for their heavy workload and academic difficulty?
What are undergraduates required to take to satisfy the Chicago Core curriculum?
During what time frame were the core classes limited to only 15 students?
As of 2017, how many courses are required under Core?

plausible_answers.text: demonstrated proficiency in a foreign language

qas.question: Other than requiring 17 classes, what else is required under Core as of 2013-2014?

plausible_answers.text: demanding standards, heavy workload and academic difficulty

qas.question: What are graduate courses at the U of C known for?

context: Undergraduate students are required to take a <b4_0>distribution of courses<b4_0/> to satisfy the university's core curriculum known as <a0_0>the <a0_1><a0_2>Common Core<a0_2/><a0_1/><a0_0/>. In <b5_0>2012-2013<b5_0/>, the Core classes at Chicago were limited to <a1_0><a1_1><a1_2>17<a1_2/><a1_1/><a1_0/> students, and are generally led by a full-time professor (as opposed to a teaching assistant). As of the 2013–2014 school year, <b6_0>15<b6_0/> courses and <b7_0>demonstrated proficiency in a foreign language<b7_0/> are required under the Core. Undergraduate courses at the University of Chicago are known for their <b8_0>demanding standards, heavy workload and academic difficulty<b8_0/>; according to <a3_0><a3_1><a3_2>Uni in the USA<a3_2/><a3_1/><a3_0/>, "Among the academic cream of American universities – Harvard, Yale, Princeton, MIT, and the University of Chicago – it is UChicago that can most convincingly claim to provide <a2_0><a2_1>the most rigorous, intense<a2_1/><a2_0/> learning experience."
